results.title: Grandma Jessie
results.brief_description: In this very personal story, Stephanie King pays tribute to her Grandma Jessie and reflects on the influence her upbringing by her grandmother has had on her own education and outlook.

results.title: Running to stand still
results.brief_description: Adrian Bush tells the story of how, after spending most of his life on the move, he found friendship and a sense of belonging playing street soccer in Fitzroy, Melbourne, with others from the Big Issue team. Adrian was selected for the Australian street soccer team, which toured internationally, and appeared in an ABC documentary. His experiences with the Big Issue and street soccer have transformed Adrian’s life.

results.title: A Christmas story
results.creator_credit: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After the Australian Government’s 2008 introduction of a new ‘income management’ regime for Northern Territory Aboriginal Australians, many families were unable to celebrate Christmas as usual. Djuma Dawes tells how his mother and other supporters, including Rotary Australia, arranged for the delivery of 16,000 Christmas presents across the Territory, believing that ‘everyone deserves to have a Merry Christmas.’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: After the Australian Government’s 2008 introduction of a new ‘income management’ regime for Northern Territory Aboriginal Australians, many families were unable to celebrate Christmas as usual. results.title: A Colour Box
results.brief_description: The purely abstract A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement.

constellations_other.name: Circling expanded cinema
constellations_other.description: Explore how expanded cinema like Lis Rhodes' Light Music connects to film composers, experimental materials and virtual reality.

results.description: The purely abstract A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement, with the addition of a “cheaper parcel post” message. Note: this film has been restored by the National Film and Television Archive (UK) from Lye’s original material using the Eastmancolor process.
description_for_label: The purely abstract A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement, with the addition of a “cheaper parcel post” message. Note: this film has been restored by the National Film and Television Archive (UK) from Lye’s original material using the Eastmancolor process.

results.title: Tusalava
results.brief_description: 1. Lye’s first film was originally accompanied by live music by Jack Ellit. No score was ever found, so the film presented here is silent, a vision of the beginnings of life on earth - mixing Maori, silent and modernist influences.
results.description: 1. Lye’s first film was originally accompanied by live music by Jack Ellit. No score was ever found, so the film presented here is silent, a vision of the beginnings of life on earth - mixing Maori, silent and modernist influences.

results.title: Rhythm
results.brief_description:
Originally planned as a work for Chrysler Corporation’s weekly television program, ‘Rhythm’ presents a montage of the factory workers, machinery and materials on a car production assembly line.
Lye has edited his footage with a staccato feel that he has matched with the percussive music used for the soundtrack.
Although rejected by Chrysler, the film won first prize in the television category in the 1957 New York Art Directors’ Festival but was subsequently disqualified because it had never been broadcast.
results.description:

Lye has edited his footage with a staccato feel that he has matched with the percussive music used for the soundtrack.
Although rejected by Chrysler, the film won first prize in the television category in the 1957 New York Art Directors’ Festival but was subsequently disqualified because it had never been broadcast.
description_for_label:
Originally planned as a work for Chrysler Corporation’s weekly television program, ‘Rhythm’ presents a montage of the factory workers, machinery and materials on a car production assembly line.
Lye has edited his footage with a staccato feel that he has matched with the percussive music used for the soundtrack.
Although rejected by Chrysler, the film won first prize in the television category in the 1957 New York Art Directors’ Festival but was subsequently disqualified because it had never been broadcast.

results.title: The Ties that bind
results.creator_credit: Milad Bardan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It took seven years after the death of his mother and a political assassination in his birth country of Lebanon before Milad really got to know his father. This is a tribute to that man.
